required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial Comparing the PICOPREP Tailored Dosing Schedule to the PICOPREP Day-before Dosing Schedule for Colon Cleansing in Preparation for Colonoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Assessor-blinded, Multi-centre Trial Comparing the Efficacy, Safety and Tolerability of the PICOPREP Tailored Dosing Schedule to the PICOPREP Day-before Dosing Schedule for Colon Cleansing in Preparation for Colonoscopy

brief_summary.textblock: This was a phase 3, randomised, assessor‑blinded, multi‑centre trial comparing the efficacy, safety and tolerability of a PICOPREP tailored dosing schedule to the PICOPREP day‑before dosing schedule for colon cleansing in preparation for colonoscopy.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Colon Cleansing Procedure (ITT) Measured by the Total Ottawa Scale
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the total Ottawa Scale score during the colonoscopy performed by a colonoscopist blinded to the dosing schedules. Total Ottawa Scale score was computed by adding the ratings (0 to 4; 0=excellent, 1=good, 2=fair, 3=poor, 4=inadequate) for each of the three colon segments and the overall fluid quality rating (0 to 2). The final score ranged from 0 (excellent) to 14 (solid stool in each colon segment and lots of fluid).

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Colon Cleansing Procedure (PP) Measured by the Total Ottawa Scale
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the total Ottawa Scale score during the colonoscopy which is performed by a colonoscopist blinded to the dosing schedules. Total Ottawa Scale score was computed by adding the ratings (0 to 4; 0=excellent, 1=good, 2=fair, 3=poor, 4=inadequate) for each of the three colon segments and the overall fluid quality rating (0 to 2). The final score ranged from 0 (excellent) to 14 (solid stool in each colon segment and lots of fluid).

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects classified as responders, i.e. Ottawa Scale score of either 0 (excellent) or 1 (good), during colonoscopy performed by a colonoscopist blinded to the dosing schedules.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and Intensity of Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (screening) up to day 10 after colonoscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically Significant Changes in Vital Signs (Pulse and Blood Pressure)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (screening) up to day 10 after colonoscopy (inclusive of assessment at each visit)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline to the end-of-trial was observed for pulse and blood pressure (systolic and diastolic).

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically Significant Changes in Laboratory Values (Haematology, Clinical Chemistry, Coagulation and Urinalysis)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (screening) up to day 10 after colonoscopy (inclusive of assessment at each visit)
secondary_outcome.description: Laboratory parameters included routine haematology, clinical chemistry, coagulation and urinalysis. With the exception of urinalysis and urine pregnancy test, which was performed as dip-stick analyses at the trial site, all laboratory tests were analysed by a central laboratory.

arm_group.description: Both doses administered the day before colonoscopy.
First dose one day before colonoscopy or on the day of colonoscopy, dependent on the planned time for colonoscopy, and second dose on the day of colonoscopy.

intervention.description: Sodium Picosulfate, Magnesium Oxide and Citric Acid as PICOPREP powder for oral solution

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, 18 years of age or above, being scheduled to undergo elective colonoscopy
- Subjects must have had more than or equal to 3 spontaneous bowel movements (i.e. without use of any laxative within 24 hours before the bowel movement, with the exception for bulk-forming laxatives (ATC code A06AC)) per week for one month prior to the colonoscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute surgical abdominal conditions (e.g. acute obstruction or perforation, etc.)
- Active (acute/exacerbation of/severe/uncontrolled) Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
- Any prior colorectal surgery, excluding appendectomy, haemorrhoid surgery or prior endoscopic procedures
- Colon disease (history of colonic cancer, toxic megacolon, toxic colitis, idiopathic pseudoobstruction, hypomotility syndrome)
- Ascites
- Gastrointestinal disorder (active ulcer, outlet obstruction, retention, gastroparesis, ileus)
- Upper gastrointestinal surgery (gastric resection, gastric banding, gastric by-pass)
- Severely reduced renal function (Glomerular filtration rate (GFR) <30 (mL/min/1.73 m2))
- The subject is a pregnant (positive urine pregnancy test at Visit 1 or Visit 2) woman. Women of childbearing potential (defined, for the purpose of this trial, as all females post-puberty, not postmenopausal ≥2 years, or not surgically sterile) who do not agree to use one of the following methods of birth control from the day of signing the Informed Consent Form until End of Trial Visit are excluded:
1. Transdermal patch
2. Hormonal contraception (i.e., oral, implant, or injectable contraceptive)
3. Double-barrier birth control (i.e., condom plus intrauterine device, diaphragm plus spermicide, etc.)
4. Maintenance of a monogamous relationship with a male who has been surgically sterilised by vasectomy
5. Sexual abstinence
- The subject is a breast-feeding or lactating woman

facility.name: Ed Herriot Hopital (there may be other sites in this country)
Gastroenterologie am Bayerischen Platz (there may be other sites in this country)
Medisch Centrum Alkmaar (there may be other sites in this country)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from 11 sites in Germany, France and the Netherlands from Nov 2014 to Jun 2015.

group.title: PICOPREP Day-before Dosing Schedule
group.description: Dose 1 was given before 8:00 AM on day before colonoscopy and Dose 2 was given 6-8 hours after Dose 1. PICOPREP: Sodium Picosulfate, Magnesium Oxide and Citric Acid as PICOPREP powder for oral solution

group.title: PICOPREP Tailored Dosing Schedule
group.description: Dose 1 was given 10-18 hours before colonoscopy and Dose 2 was given 4-6 hours before colonoscopy. PICOPREP: Sodium Picosulfate, Magnesium Oxide and Citric Acid as PICOPREP powder for oral solution

baseline.population: The intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis set consisted of all randomized subjects.

group.title: PICOPREP Day-before Dosing Schedule
group.description: Dose 1 was given before 8:00 AM on day before colonoscopy and Dose 2 was given 6-8 hours after Dose 1. PICOPREP: Sodium Picosulfate, Magnesium Oxide and Citric Acid as PICOPREP powder for oral solution

group.title: PICOPREP Tailored Dosing Schedule
group.description: Dose 1 was given 10-18 hours before colonoscopy and Dose 2 was given 4-6 hours before colonoscopy. PICOPREP: Sodium Picosulfate, Magnesium Oxide and Citric Acid as PICOPREP powder for oral solution

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Overall Colon Cleansing Procedure (ITT) Measured by the Total Ottawa Scale
outcome.description: Measured by the total Ottawa Scale score during the colonoscopy performed by a colonoscopist blinded to the dosing schedules. Total Ottawa Scale score was computed by adding the ratings (0 to 4; 0=excellent, 1=good, 2=fair, 3=poor, 4=inadequate) for each of the three colon segments and the overall fluid quality rating (0 to 2). The final score ranged from 0 (excellent) to 14 (solid stool in each colon segment and lots of fluid).
outcome.population: The ITT analysis set consisted of all randomized subjects.

group.title: PICOPREP Day-before Dosing Schedule
group.description: Dose 1 was given before 8:00 AM on day before colonoscopy and Dose 2 was given 6-8 hours after Dose 1. PICOPREP: Sodium Picosulfate, Magnesium Oxide and Citric Acid as PICOPREP powder for oral solution

group.title: PICOPREP Tailored Dosing Schedule
group.description: Dose 1 was given 10-18 hours before colonoscopy and Dose 2 was given 4-6 hours before colonoscopy. PICOPREP: Sodium Picosulfate, Magnesium Oxide and Citric Acid as PICOPREP powder for oral solution

measure.title: Overall Colon Cleansing Procedure (ITT) Measured by the Total Ottawa Scale
measure.description: Measured by the total Ottawa Scale score during the colonoscopy performed by a colonoscopist blinded to the dosing schedules. Total Ottawa Scale score was computed by adding the ratings (0 to 4; 0=excellent, 1=good, 2=fair, 3=poor, 4=inadequate) for each of the three colon segments and the overall fluid quality rating (0 to 2). The final score ranged from 0 (excellent) to 14 (solid stool in each colon segment and lots of fluid).
measure.population: The ITT analysis set consisted of all randomized subjects.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis was no treatment difference between the two dosing schedules.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority is assessed by examining whether the upper limit of the 95% confidence interval is less than the specified non-inferiority margin of 1.5 points.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value corresponds to a two-sided test of superiority.
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA with treatment, country and time of colonoscopy (AM/PM) as factors.
analysis.estimate_desc: Treatment difference in mean total Ottawa Scale score was calculated as PICOPREP tailored dosing schedule minus PICOPREP day-before dosing schedule.

outcome.title: Overall Colon Cleansing Procedure (PP) Measured by the Total Ottawa Scale
outcome.description: Measured by the total Ottawa Scale score during the colonoscopy which is performed by a colonoscopist blinded to the dosing schedules. Total Ottawa Scale score was computed by adding the ratings (0 to 4; 0=excellent, 1=good, 2=fair, 3=poor, 4=inadequate) for each of the three colon segments and the overall fluid quality rating (0 to 2). The final score ranged from 0 (excellent) to 14 (solid stool in each colon segment and lots of fluid).
outcome.population: The per-protocol (PP) analysis set consisted of all the subjects included in ITT analysis set, but excluding subjects with major protocol deviations (18 subjects) that would impact efficacy analysis.

group.title: PICOPREP Day-before Dosing Schedule
group.description: Dose 1 was given before 8:00 AM on day before colonoscopy and Dose 2 was given 6-8 hours after Dose 1. PICOPREP: Sodium Picosulfate, Magnesium Oxide and Citric Acid as PICOPREP powder for oral solution

group.title: PICOPREP Tailored Dosing Schedule
group.description: Dose 1 was given 10-18 hours before colonoscopy and Dose 2 was given 4-6 hours before colonoscopy. PICOPREP: Sodium Picosulfate, Magnesium Oxide and Citric Acid as PICOPREP powder for oral solution

measure.title: Overall Colon Cleansing Procedure (PP) Measured by the Total Ottawa Scale
measure.description: Measured by the total Ottawa Scale score during the colonoscopy which is performed by a colonoscopist blinded to the dosing schedules. Total Ottawa Scale score was computed by adding the ratings (0 to 4; 0=excellent, 1=good, 2=fair, 3=poor, 4=inadequate) for each of the three colon segments and the overall fluid quality rating (0 to 2). The final score ranged from 0 (excellent) to 14 (solid stool in each colon segment and lots of fluid).
measure.population: The per-protocol (PP) analysis set consisted of all the subjects included in ITT analysis set, but excluding subjects with major protocol deviations (18 subjects) that would impact efficacy analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis was no treatment difference between the two dosing schedules.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority is assessed by examining whether the upper limit of the 95% confidence interval is less than the specified non-inferiority margin of 1.5 points.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value corresponds to a two-sided test of superiority.
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA with treatment, country and time of colonoscopy (AM/PM) as factors.
analysis.estimate_desc: Treatment difference in mean total Ottawa Scale score was calculated as PICOPREP tailored dosing schedule minus PICOPREP day-before dosing schedule.

outcome.title: Ascending Colon Cleansing Responder Status (ITT)
outcome.description: Percentage of subjects classified as responders, i.e. Ottawa Scale score of either 0 (excellent) or 1 (good), during colonoscopy performed by a colonoscopist blinded to the dosing schedules.
outcome.population: The ITT analysis set consisted of all randomized subjects.

group.title: PICOPREP Day-before Dosing Schedule
group.description: Dose 1 was given before 8:00 AM on day before colonoscopy and Dose 2 was given 6-8 hours after Dose 1. PICOPREP: Sodium Picosulfate, Magnesium Oxide and Citric Acid as PICOPREP powder for oral solution

group.title: PICOPREP Tailored Dosing Schedule
group.description: Dose 1 was given 10-18 hours before colonoscopy and Dose 2 was given 4-6 hours before colonoscopy. PICOPREP: Sodium Picosulfate, Magnesium Oxide and Citric Acid as PICOPREP powder for oral solution

measure.title: Ascending Colon Cleansing Responder Status (ITT)
measure.description: Percentage of subjects classified as responders, i.e. Ottawa Scale score of either 0 (excellent) or 1 (good), during colonoscopy performed by a colonoscopist blinded to the dosing schedules.
measure.population: The ITT analysis set consisted of all randomized subjects.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis was no treatment difference between the two dosing schedules.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value corresponds to a two-sided test of superiority.
analysis.method_desc: Logistic regression with the failure/success status as dependent variable, and treatment, country and timing of colonoscopy as factors.
analysis.estimate_desc: The estimated odds ratio compares the odds of being a responder in the PICOPREP tailored dosing schedule vs. the PICOPREP day-before dosing schedule.

outcome.time_frame: From baseline (screening) up to day 10 after colonoscopy
outcome.population: The Safety analysis set consisted of all treated subjects and was analyzed according to the actual treatment received.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review the draft manuscript prior to publication and can request delay of publication where any contents are deemed patentable by the sponsor or confidential to the sponsor. Comments will be given within four weeks from receipt of the draft manuscript. Additional time may be required to allow Ferring to seek patent protection of the invention.
